    • Method Detail

      • fileSizeAsStr

        public static String fileSizeAsStr(long size)
        Formats a byte size (for example the size of a file) into an easy-to-read string. It is somewhat similar to the -h option which exist on many Unix/Linux commands. Readability is favored over precision.

        Note that the method uses the abbreviations "KB", "MB" and "GB" to denote 1024 bytes, 10242 bytes and 10243 bytes. Strictly speaking this is incorrect but this is what most operating systems do as well.

        Rules are as follows:
        If the size is <1 KB : Will be shown as-is. Example returned string: "361 bytes"
        If the size is >= 1 KB and < 1 MB : Will be shown as KB value with no decimals. Example returned string: "76 KB"
        If the size is >= 1 MB and < 1 GB : Will be shown as MB value with 1 decimal. Example returned string: "323.4 MB"
        If the size is >= 1 GB : Will be shown as GB value with 2 decimal. Example returned string: "1.42 GB"

        Except for input values above 1 TB the returned string will never be more than 9 bytes in length.

        Parameters:
        size - byte size
        Returns:
        formatted string

      • stripHtml

        public static String stripHtml(String str)
        Strips a string from HTML markup. Elements <br>,<p>, <h1>, <h2> and <h3> are replaced with with new line. This produces a string which is readable as plain text.

        Note: The method is simple and crude. It will not work on malformed HTML or if there are un-escaped < or > outside of the HTML tags. However, for all but the most complex use cases, the method will probably work just fine.

        Parameters:
        str -
        Returns:

      • getHttpStatusCodeText

        public static String getHttpStatusCodeText(int sc)
        Gets the numerical HTTP status code concatenated with the text representing that status code, for example "403 Forbidden".

        If the status code is unknown then the text will be "<Unknown status code>".

        Parameters:
        sc - numerical HTTP status code
        Returns:
